%
%                        TeXdraw input file for plain TeX
%
%           None of the following definitions can be modified, as these
%           command names will be generated by TeXdraw!
%           No other command strings will be generated.
%
\font\pntfont=pointsc
%
%           Other TeXdraw fonts are in pairs, each pair corresponds to one 
%           curve width. Only fonts of widths used will be loaded.
%
%
%           New command names for TeXdraw.
%
\def\draw#1,#2,#3{}
\newdimen\microdimen \microdimen=0.114155251pt
\newdimen\lengthunit \lengthunit=0.913242009mm
\def\drawing#1{\leavevmode#1}
\def\hadjust#1 {\kern#1\microdimen}
\def\rseg#1 #2 {\raise#1\microdimen\hbox{\char#2}}
\def\filledbox#1 #2 {\vrule width#1\lengthunit height#2\lengthunit depth0\lengthunit}
\def\Segwid#1#2{\font\shortSegs=SSEGC#1#2  \font\longSegs=LSEGC#1#2\relax}
%
%           The following command can be used to put text and formula
%           in drawings: it places #3 to coordinates #1,#2.
%
\def\placeat#1,#2,#3{\raise#2\lengthunit\rlap{\kern#1\lengthunit #3}}
%
%           The next command is only generated by the WYSIWYG version.
%
\def\drawingbox#1#2,{\leavevmode #1\kern#2\lengthunit}
%
\endinput



